entry.title: Content with XML and summary
entry.summary: If you're seeing this, your feed reader is doing a good thing. It doesn't understand the content so it is showing the text summary instead.

a.b:
If you're seeing this, something is wrong. Your feed reader is likely
trying to render arbitrary XML content as if it were HTML.

entry.title: Content with src attribute and summary
entry.summary: If you're seeing this, your feed reader is doing a good thing. It doesn't understand the content so it is showing the text summary instead.

entry.title: Summary then Content
entry.summary: Does it show summary? It's ok if your reader shows this, but it is good to know whether or not your reader has a preference for showing the summary rather than the content
entry.content: Does it show content? It's ok if your reader shows this, but it is good to know whether or not your reader has a preference for showing the content rather than the summary

entry.title: Content then Summary
entry.content: Does it show content? It's ok if your reader shows this, but it is good to know whether or not your reader has a preference for showing the content rather than the summary
entry.summary: Does it show summary? It's ok if your reader shows this, but it is good to know whether or not your reader has a preference for showing the summary rather than the content

entry.title: Content with iCal and Summary
entry.summary: If you see this, your feed reader is doing a good thing. The content contains iCalendar data that shouldn't be displayed. If the reader doesn't understand the content type, it likely should not attempt to display it if a text summary is available.

entry.title: Content with Base64 encoded image
entry.summary: If you're seeing this, your feed reader is doing good. Alternatively, your feed reader might be smart enough to Base64 decode the content and show you the GIF image. If all you're seeing is a bunch of Base64 encoded stuff, then your feed reader is broken.
